ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The assembly will be routed and will turn their backs in flight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The army will be routed and put to flight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Soon shall this legion be routed and shall turn their backs and flee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Let them know that) this united group will soon run away in defeat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The group will soon be routed, and will turn their backs to flee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Soon shall the hosts be routed, and they shall turn (their) backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Certainly the host shall be routed, and turn their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The hosts shall soon be routed and they shall be put to flight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Anon will their multitude be vanquished, and they will turn the back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The league will be routed and turn its back [to flee].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Most certainly their gatherings shall be routed, and they will turn their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The multitude will be defeated, and they will turn their backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:45] The host will [truly] be routed and turn its back [to flee], and so they were defeated at Badr and God’s Messenger (s) was granted victory over them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The hosts) the hosts of the disbelieving (will all be routed) on the Day of Badr (and will turn and flee) defeated; this refers to Abu Jahl and his host, some of whom were killed on the Day of Badr and others defeated.
